Field.label: Bathymetry Dataset
Field.toolTip: Specifies the dataset and resolution to use. Selecting smaller cell sizes will use a higher resolution bathymetry and give better results, but will cause the request to take longer to complete.

Field.label: Northern Grid Boundary
Field.toolTip: The Northern Latitude boundary for your study area in Decimal Degrees.

Field.label: Southern Grid Boundary
Field.toolTip: The Southern Latitude boundary for your study area in Decimal Degrees.

Field.label: Western Grid Boundary
Field.toolTip: The Western Longitude boundary for your study area in Decimal Degrees.

Field.label: Eastern Grid Boundary
Field.toolTip: The Eastern Longitude boundary for your study area in Decimal Degrees.

Field.label: Fish Model Algorithm
Field.toolTip: Specifies which animal movement model should be used to populate the animal behavior grid.

HField.label: Home Range Center (X value)
HField.toolTip: Longitude co-ordiante of the home range center. Value must be in decimal degrees.

HField.label: Home Range Center (Y value)
HField.toolTip: Latitude co-ordiante of the home range center. Value must be in decimal degrees.

HField.label: Home Range Extent (X value)
HField.toolTip: SD of the home range in meters in the x direction.

HField.label: Home Range Extent (Y value)
HField.toolTip: SD of the home range in meters in the y direction.

HField.label: Directional Correlation of Home Range
HField.toolTip: The correlation between x and y directions, -1 < x < 1. Determines the tilt of the homerange area.

Field.label: Restrict Vertical Habitat Range
Field.toolTip: Restricts animal movement to habitat cells within the given depth range.

HField.label: Min Depth
HField.toolTip: Specifies the shallowest cell an animal will visit. Units are in negative meters

HField.label: Max Depth
HField.toolTip: Specifies the deepest cell an animal will visit. Units are in negative meters.

Field.label: Use Depth Preference
Field.toolTip: Normally distributes animals in the water column according to a given mean and SD.

HField.label: Preferred Depth
HField.toolTip: Depth preference of fish relative to the sea floor (in meters off the bottom).

HField.label: SD of Preferred Depth
HField.toolTip: Standard deviation of preferred depth (in meters). Animals spend 95% of their time within plus/minus 2 SD of their preferred depth.

Field.label: User-Specified Sensors
Field.toolTip: List of already existing sensors. These sensors are placed and down-weighed before running the program. Useful for including already existing sensors, or forcing the placement of a few sensors. Do not include these sensors in the sensor count below. Provide sensor locations as a string in the format: <sensor1_Long>, <sensor1_Lat>, <sensor2_Long>, <sensor2_Lat>...

Field.label: Number of Sensors to Use
Field.toolTip: The number of sensors the system should place optimally.

Field.label: Number of Sensors to Project
Field.toolTip: The number of theoretical sensors to be placed by the system. These sensors will be placed in addition to any sensors specified above. This option lets you see what adding more sensors to your setup does to your recovery rate.

Field.label: 'Goodness' Algorithm
Field.toolTip: Specifies how the program determines the goodness of a cell. A value of 1 bases goodness on fish presence, regardless of bathymetry. A value of 2 bases goodness on bathymetric visibility, regardless of fish presence A value of 3 bases goodness on the number of visible fish (both fish habitat and bathymetry are considered).

Field.label: Sensor Elevation
Field.toolTip: Elevation of all sensors off of the bottom in meters. This is includes any moorings used.

Field.label: Sensor Shape Function
Field.toolTip: Determines which shape function to use for simulating signal attenuation. 'shape.gauss' is currently the only supported shape function.

Field.label: Max Detection Value
Field.toolTip: The probability of detecting a fish right next to your sensor. Specifies a maximum value for the shape function.

Field.label: Detection Range
Field.toolTip: The distance in meters from the sensor where the probability of detecting a signal falls below 0.05.

Field.label: Suppression Factor
Field.toolTip: Specifies the ratio of suppression range to sensor detection range. Larger values cause sensors to be placed farther apart. We recommend a value of at least 2. See the documentation for an explaination of the suppression mechanism

Field.label: Suppression Function
Field.toolTip: The suppression function to use. suppression.static will simply replace all cells within the suppression range by a static value. suppression.scale will apply a gradient with a higher penalty near the center, and a lower penalty towards the edge.

Field.label: Max Suppression Value
Field.toolTip: Specifies the maximum suppression penalty to apply.

Field.label: Min Suppression Value
Field.toolTip: Specifies the minimum suppression penalty to apply.
